author: Franklin Manchester
title: The Holiday Inn Westbury - Long Island Is Hosting A Special Saturday Night (All Hallows Eve) Halloween Party For Guests To Have A Frightening Good Time.
text:
On Saturday, October 31st (All Hallows Eve) the Holiday Inn Westbury will be hosting a special Halloween Party for Long Islanders to partake in. The party will be held in their main ballroom, which is the Hotel's Long Island Room that may accommodate up to 120 guests. The event will provide guests with a Top Shelf open bar, prizes for best costume categories, a delicious buffet style dinner , a spooky selfie photo booth (equipped with props), DJ entertainment, dance floor, frightening decor and more. Costume prize categories include, Best Costume, Best Couples Costume and Best Group Costume. The Best Costume winner will receive a complimentary overnight stay with breakfast for two guests. The Best Couples Costume winners will receive 50,000 IHG Rewards Club Points, which can be used for up to two free nights at nearly 4,700 hotels worldwide. Best Group Costume winners will receive a complimentary two hour open bar and appetizer cocktail reception for up to twenty guests.
The price to attend is $50.00 per person, plus tax and gratuity, and a special discount applies for those that reserve a table of ten. Tables are $400.00. Ticket purchases and registration may take place directly through the Hotel's website and Halloween Party Blog .
The deadline to RSVP is Wednesday, October 21st, and reservations will be made on a first come, first serve basis. Guests are encouraged to register early to guarantee a spot at a spectacular Halloween Bash with the Holiday Inn Westbury. The Hotel's Corporate Sales Manager, Steff Marrero has put this event together, and Halloween happens to be one of her favorite holidays, so guests can be sure they'll be in for a scary treat. In regards to Halloween, Steff said, "I love Halloween because people get to escape from reality for a bit. They can be something, or even somebody they are not ordinarily, and just have a good time doing so. It's great to see how creative people can be, and seeing people play out a role in costume is very similar to the art of acting, which is something I am very interested in. Halloween falling on a Saturday night to me just ads to the entire day, and especially the evening. I am not only putting the event together, I am going to be a part of it."
For additional information, guests may contact Steff direct at the Hotel via phone at 516-213-9102. Steff can also be e-mailed at smarrero(at)hiwestbury(dot)com. For special discounts on overnight accommodations, guests must reserve their rooms directly with Steff. The special discounted rate for a room is $149.00 for two guests, and $169.00 for a room and breakfast vouchers for two.
Halloween party attendees and hotel guests must be 21 years of age and older. Proper photo ID will be required at the door, and upon hotel check-in.
